text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c9edd6b58218d25bfc5389af901021dc0eb82578|patch 8.2.1437: Vim9: 'statusline' is evaluated using Vim9 script syntax>
patch 8.2.1437: Vim9: 'statusline' is evaluated using Vim9 script syntax

Problem:    Vim9: 'statusline' is evaluated using Vim9 script syntax.
Solution:   Always use legacy script syntax.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1437: Vim9: 'statusline' is evaluated using Vim9 script syntax · vim/vim@c9edd6b
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1437: Vim9: 'statusline' is evaluated using Vim9 script syntax · vim/vim@c9edd6b
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: 'statusline' is evaluated using Vim9 script syntax. Solution: Always use legacy script syntax.

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/66e0014ba651208ab7579797866ab0e4bd9e2b49|patch 8.2.1436: function implementing :substitute has unexpected name>
patch 8.2.1436: function implementing :substitute has unexpected name

Problem:    Function implementing :substitute has unexpected name.
Solution:   Rename from do_sub() to ex_substitute().

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1436: function implementing :substitute has unexpected name · vim/vim@66e0014
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1436: function implementing :substitute has unexpected name · vim/vim@66e0014
attachments.text: Problem: Function implementing :substitute has unexpected name. Solution: Rename from do_sub() to ex_substitute().

patch 8.2.1435: Vim9: always converting to string for ".." leads to mistakes

Problem:    Vim9: always converting to string for ".." leads to mistakes.
Solution:   Only automatically convert simple types.

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/fd77748df2ba7d5f38aab649cb630374620462d7|patch 8.2.1434: Vim9: crash when lambda uses outer function argument>
patch 8.2.1434: Vim9: crash when lambda uses outer function argument

Problem:    Vim9: crash when lambda uses outer function argument.
Solution:   Set the flag that the outer context is used.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1434: Vim9: crash when lambda uses outer function argument · vim/vim@fd77748
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1434: Vim9: crash when lambda uses outer function argument · vim/vim@fd77748
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: crash when lambda uses outer function argument. Solution: Set the flag that the outer context is used.

patch 8.2.1433: Vim9: cannot mingle comments in multi-line lambda

Problem:    Vim9: cannot mingle comments in multi-line lambda.
Solution:   Skip over NULL lines. (closes #6694)

patch 8.2.1432: various inconsistencies in test files

Problem:    Various inconsistencies in test files.
Solution:   Add modelines where they were missing.  Use Check commands instead
            of silently skipping over tests.  Adjust indents and comments.
            (Ken Takata, closes #6695)

patch 8.2.1431: Vim9: no error for white space before comma in dict

patch 8.2.1430: Vim9: error for missing comma instead of extra white space

Problem:    Vim9: error for missing comma instead of extra white space.
Solution:   Check if comma can be found after white space. (closes #6668)
            Also check for extra white space in literal dict. (closes #6670)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/17a836cbee6b8d8ff555f8e307f48a779908db41|patch 8.2.1429: Vim9: no error for missing white after : in dict>
patch 8.2.1429: Vim9: no error for missing white after : in dict

Problem:    Vim9: no error for missing white after : in dict.
Solution:   Check for white space. (closes #6671)  Also check that there is no
            white before the :.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1429: Vim9: no error for missing white after : in dict · vim/vim@17a836c
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1429: Vim9: no error for missing white after : in dict · vim/vim@17a836c
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: no error for missing white after : in dict. Solution: Check for white space. (closes #6671) Also check that there is no white before the :.
